definition: top (of the head)/apex/to fall forwards/inverted/to jolt
to topple (i.e. knock over)/to capsize/fig. to overturn (a regime, by plotting or subversion)/to undermine/to subvert
to turn upside down/to reverse/back to front/confused/deranged/crazy
lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
to harp on/over and over/merely ring changes on a few terms

sentences.english: In Shangba the river brings death not sustenance.
sentences.chinese: 河流给上坝带来颠杌是生机，而是死亡。

sentences.english: The tin can bounced down the steps.
sentences.chinese: 那听子一路颠跳着滚下了台阶。

sentences.english: On the base that plays sanded bag in adroitness control, let a student change bump handball.
sentences.chinese: 在熟练掌握踢沙包的基础上，让学生改换颠手球。

sentences.english: The sudden jolt plunged her forward.
sentences.chinese: 突然颠了一下，她向前打了一个趔趄。

sentences.english: The suitcase bounced down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 衣箱一路颠跳着滚下楼梯。

sentences.english: She bounced the baby on her knee.
sentences.chinese: 她把婴儿放在膝上颠着玩。

sentences.english: Only pneumococcal meningitis had a peak incidence in spring.
sentences.chinese: 又只有肺炎双球菌有明显的春季流行颠峰峰。

sentences.english: Nestled in the Himalayas, bordering the world's highest peak, Mount Everest, lies tiny landlocked Nepal.
sentences.chinese: 珠穆朗玛峰雄踞世界屋脊喜马拉雅山颠。

definition: to step on/to tread on/to wear (shoes)/(slang) to dump (sb)/Taiwan pr. [deng4]
indifferent to the passing of time/careless
to put into (one's pockets, clothes)/Taiwan pr. [chuai3]
to hang or suspend/to worry/public announcement/unresolved/baseless/without foundation
to rotate/to twirl/to run around/to encircle/rotation/(coll.) to speak indirectly/to beat about the bush
